name: Shawarma-Style Chicken Thighs with Sautéed Cabbage and Lemon-Tahini
description: Pan-seared, mildly spiced chicken thigh fillets with a quick lemon-tahini drizzle, served over sautéed cabbage and onions. A fast, keto-friendly family plate with Middle Eastern flavors.
prep_steps: Zest and juice 1 large lemon (keep separate).
In a small bowl, mix 1.5 tsp paprika, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and 1/2 tsp salt.
cook_steps: Season chicken: In a bowl, toss 800 g chicken thigh fillets with spice mix, 1 tbsp olive oil, and half the minced garlic.
Sear chicken: Heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high with 1 tbsp olive oil. Sear chicken 3–4 min per side until browned.
Finish in oven: Transfer skillet to oven and cook 6–8 min until cooked through (juices run clear). Rest 3 min, then slice.

Sauté veg: While chicken bakes, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a second large pan over medium. Add onions and remaining garlic; cook 1–2 min. Add cabbage, 1/2 tsp salt, and sauté 6–8 min until tender-crisp.
Make sauce: In a cup, whisk 1/4 cup tahini with lemon juice and zest. Thin with a splash of olive oil if needed. Season with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Plate: Divide sautéed cabbage among plates. Top with sliced chicken. Spoon over lemon-tahini and sprinkle with parsley.
